full_text: OFFICE OF THE STATE ATTORNEY FIFTEENTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT OF FLORIDA IN AND FOR PALM BEACH COUNTY April 17, 2006 BARRY E. KRISCHER STATE ATTORNEY GUY P. FRONSTIN, ESQUIRE 515 NORTH FLAGLER DRIVE SUITE 300 WEST PALM BEACH, FL 33401 Re: State of Florida vs. Jeffrey Epstein Dear Guy: By this letter, I am confirming the offer of settlement to your client, Jeffrey Epstein. Should you accept this settlement, the state will not proceed with Grand Jury proceedings tomorrow. Plea to Aggravated Assault with the Intent to Commit a Felony, a third degree felony. Adjudication will be withheld and your client will be placed on 5 years probation with the following conditions: no contact, direct or indirect, with victim ; no contact with minors unless supervised by an approved adult with knowledge of the underlying facts, but in no case shall the supervising adult by Nadia Marcinkova or Sarah Kellen; psycho-sexual evaluation and successful completion of any recommended treatment and the evaluator must be approved by the Department of Corrections; full payment of the costs of investigation by the Palm Beach Police Department; and may apply for early termination of probation after 3 years if there are no violations and all conditions have been successfully completed. This offer of settlement shall cover all the allegations against your client investigated by the Palm Beach Police Department in case number 05-000368. Please confirm acceptance in writing as soon as possible to 561-355-7302. Sincerely LANNA BELOHLAVEK Assistant State Attorney LB/lb 401 N. Dixie Highway, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401-4209 (561) 355-7100 07/26/17 Page 48 of 100 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031987 reject

text_blocks.content: OFFICE OF THE STATE ATTORNEY FIFTEENTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT OF FLORIDA IN AND FOR PALM BEACH COUNTY April 17, 2006
GUY P. FRONSTIN, ESQUIRE 515 NORTH FLAGLER DRIVE SUITE 300 WEST PALM BEACH, FL 33401
Re: State of Florida vs. Jeffrey Epstein
By this letter, I am confirming the offer of settlement to your client, Jeffrey Epstein. Should you accept this settlement, the state will not proceed with Grand Jury proceedings tomorrow.

Plea to Aggravated Assault with the Intent to Commit a Felony, a third degree felony. Adjudication will be withheld and your client will be placed on 5 years probation with the following conditions: no contact, direct or indirect, with victim ; no contact with minors unless supervised by an approved adult with knowledge of the underlying facts, but in no case shall the supervising adult by Nadia Marcinkova or Sarah Kellen; psycho-sexual evaluation and successful completion of any recommended treatment and the evaluator must be approved by the Department of Corrections; full payment of the costs of investigation by the Palm Beach Police Department; and may apply for early termination of probation after 3 years if there are no violations and all conditions have been successfully completed. This offer of settlement shall cover all the allegations against your client investigated by the Palm Beach Police Department in case number 05-000368.
Please confirm acceptance in writing as soon as possible to 561-355-7302.
Sincerely LANNA BELOHLAVEK Assistant State Attorney
LB/lb 401 N. Dixie Highway, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401-4209 (561) 355-7100

additional_notes: The document appears to be a letter from the Office of the State Attorney to Guy P. Fronstin, Esquire, regarding a settlement offer to Jeffrey Epstein. The letter outlines the terms of the settlement, including a plea to Aggravated Assault with the Intent to Commit a Felony and conditions for probation. The document has a handwritten note 'reject' in the margin.
